item.title: [PI] Please take a look in here!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Seems to be a slight language barrier but if you are trying to get a message to print every 1000 loops than the modulo/modulus/remainder operator is the best way to go about doing that.

[quote=“ohokay, post:4, topic:542303”]Use the modulo operator “%”

if (i % 1000 == 0)[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Please take a look in here!

item.title: [PI] Please take a look in here!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:4, topic:542303”]Use the modulo operator “%”

if (i % 1000 == 0)[/quote]
We do not understand your full question, but if you just want every 1000th output use this.

if (i % 1000 == 0)
c.sendMessage(i+" lines loaded.");
% acts as “remainder” for positive integers even though it is a little more complex in theory.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Please take a look in here!
item.dc:creator: @Quintorz Quintorz
item.description:
@Quintorz wrote:

[quote=“DeathsChaos9, post:2, topic:542303”]Your computer will count to 1000 before you can even blink. If you wish to delay something there are three ways (or I use three different ways) to delay and event. The first is a timer, there’s a tutorial for that in the tutorial section. You can also create an event, quite similar to a timer. The easy way out is to make use of the sleep method in the Thread class. This will delay the execution of your code by X milliseconds.

try { Thread.sleep(1000); // 1 second } catch (Exception e) { // Whoops... }

Hope that’s what you were asking for.[/quote]

Thats not what i ment, i ment like…

i need to get the “i” to get shown every 1000 “i”'s i need a code for this

if (i == 1000 || i == 2000 ||i == 3000 ||i == 4000);{ and so on how do i make this code detect the "i" every 1000 "i's" instead of this long code c.sendMessage(i+" lines loaded"); }
which i dont need to make longer to make it tell me when the I == 3000 or 4000 and so on

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Please take a look in here!

item.title: [PI] Please take a look in here!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Your computer will count to 1000 before you can even blink. If you wish to delay something there are three ways (or I use three different ways) to delay and event. The first is a timer, there’s a tutorial for that in the tutorial section. You can also create an event, quite similar to a timer. The easy way out is to make use of the sleep method in the Thread class. This will delay the execution of your code by X milliseconds.

try { Thread.sleep(1000); // 1 second } catch (Exception e) { // Whoops... }

Hope that’s what you were asking for.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Please take a look in here!

item.title: [PI] Please take a look in here!
item.dc:creator: @Quintorz Quintorz
item.description:
@Quintorz wrote:

sorry for double post, i didnt see that i posted the other in client help

soo…

i made this code :

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“test”)){
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" “);
for(int i = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); i < Integer.parseInt(args[2]); i++){
c.sendMessage(”." + i + “.”);
if (i == 1000 ||i == 5000 ||i == 10000 ||i == 25000 ||i == 50000 ||i == 75000 ||i == 100000){
c.sendMessage(i+" lines loaded");
}

		}

	}[/code]

i type ::test 0 1000 etc… and it starts counting verry fast… my question is if there is another way to make it do the “c.sendMessage(i+“lines loaded”);” thing like a code to make it do it every 1000 “i’s”? instead of i have to make this longer :

if (i == 1000 ||i == 5000 ||i == 10000 ||i == 25000 ||i == 50000 ||i == 75000 ||i == 100000){
sorry for my bad english guys, but i hope you know what i mean

hope you can help me!

Read full topic
